Our stay was during a major blizzard. The “storm of the century” they called it! Before the weather hit, Dianne sent a friendly suggestion to stock up on food in case we were snowed in, which ended up being the case. As the community endured the major event, Diane checked in on us daily to make sure we were safe and warm. Thankfully, we never lost power (unlike many in the neighborhood and surrounding areas). The home was cozy and comfortable and we had the “White Christmas” we were hoping for. We made a snowman in the back.
As our departure date approached, Dianne was super flexible and let us extend our stay until the travel ban was lifted. We actually ended up extending our stay a second time because we were so comfortable in her home. The furnishings were lovely. The home was clean with plenty of towels and linens. And space to come together as a family. There aren’t words to describe how amazing Dianne was. Although we never met in person, we grew a bond by the time we left.
